issue.title: sktime v0.12.1
issue.body: Checklist * [x] Used a [personal fork of the feedstock to propose changes](https://conda-forge.org/docs/maintainer/updating_pkgs.html#forking-and-pull-requests) * [ ] Bumped the build number (if the version is unchanged) * [x] Reset the build number to `0` (if the version changed) * [x] [Re-rendered]( https://conda-forge.org/docs/maintainer/updating_pkgs.html#rerendering-feedstocks ) with the latest `conda-smithy` (Use the phrase @conda-forge-admin, please rerender in a comment in this PR for automated rerendering) * [ ] Ensured the license file is being packaged. Related: - https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2921 - https://github.com/conda-forge/sktime-feedstock/issues/44

body:
Currently the build on linux py39 fails with

```
The reported errors are:
- Encountered problems while solving:
-   - package sktime-0.12.1-py39h5a03fae_1 requires python >=3.9,<3.10.0a0, but none of the providers can be installed
```
more logs
[https://dev.azure.com/conda-forge/feedstock-builds/_build/results?buildId=530943&vi[…]413-330699242c05&t=c10fa5f2-fdf6-5338-3bdb-c4bea7c23412&l=3135](https://dev.azure.com/conda-forge/feedstock-builds/_build/results?buildId=530943&view=logs&j=517fe804-fa30-5dc2-1413-330699242c05&t=c10fa5f2-fdf6-5338-3bdb-c4bea7c23412&l=3135)

py38 says something different:
```
package sktime-all-extras-0.12.1-ha770c72_1 requires numba >=0.53, but none of the providers can be installed
```
I am trying to debug, so making changes to the PR

issue.title: [BUG] Cannot install `sktime-all-extras` in codespaces

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
I am trying to install sktime using the command
conda install -c conda-forge sktime-all-extras
I am using GitHub codespaces.I tried various ways to solve this issue but nothing seemed to work.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56045049/178091179-646270e0-fffd-44b7-99f9-5e880ebb2322.png)

body:
more logs 
```
failed to get install actions, retrying.  exception was: Unsatisfiable dependencies for platform linux-64: {"hcrystalball[version='>=0.1.9']", "prophet[version='>=1.1']", "scikit-posthocs[version='>=0.6.5']", "tbats[version='>=1.1.0']"}
```
I found a config that works for `sktime` but there are still conflicts for `sktime-all-extras`

Adding `prophet` to a successful CI run, works for 
- linux py37
 
but fails for 
- linux py38
- linux py39

with:
```

The reported errors are:
- Encountered problems while solving:
-   - package sktime-0.12.1-py39h5a03fae_1 requires numba >=0.53, but none of the providers can be installed
```

It seems that prophet is the problem... I think we can merge and release without prophet which then can be installed through pip, Appreciate some comments here @fkiraly @freddyaboulton @dhirschfeld 

An alternative would be to debug what goes wrong in deps resolution with prophet but conda-forge build is not very straightforward and was wasn't able to reproduce the build process locally yet and I'm not sure if it's worth investing time into this.

> *I think we can merge and release without prophet which then can be installed through pip*

I think that's fine & probably the best you can do for now. I'd say merge with this workaround and the `prophet` install can be debugged in a separate PR so as to not hold up this release.

Thanks @dhirschfeld. I managed to further restrict prophet install by platform and python version so prophet will be a dependency for `sktime-all-extras` for all platforms except linux with py38 or py39. I agree, we should push the release out and debug separately.

Here's a short summary and current status of the issues affecting conda release:
1. conda bot not creating a PR after the release on PyPI - AFAIK it is unresolved and undiagnosed, I looked into it but didn't get far
2. source url changing in the meta.yaml and now requiring and extra . after the v of the version - updated in the PR
3. `prophet >=1.1`  creating dependency resolution error on linux py38 and py39 - worked around by skipping this conda dep in the CI for the specific platforms
4. unnecessary deps specified in host section - cleaned up in the PR
